examples.text: the essential goodness of human nature
At least **have the goodness** *(= good manners)* to look at me when I'm talking to you.
We like to think that goodness exists in everyone.

definitions.definition: the part of something that has a useful effect on somebody/something, especially somebody’s health

examples.text: These vegetables have had all the goodness boiled out of them.
Branches pruned from the trees are shredded so the goodness goes back into the soil.

definitions.definition: used to emphasize that you do not know something

examples.text: God knows what else they might find.

definitions.definition: used to emphasize the truth of what you are saying

examples.text: She ought to pass the exam—goodness knows she's been working hard enough.
My goodness, you have been busy!

definitions.definition: used to emphasize that what you are saying is true

examples.text: Honest to God, Mary, I'm not joking.

definitions.definition: because of kind feelings, without thinking about what advantage there will be for you

examples.text: You're not telling me he offered to lend you the money out of the goodness of his heart?

definitions.definition: used to say that you are pleased about something

examples.text: ‘Thank goodness for that!’ she said with a sigh of relief.
Thank heavens I've found my keys.

definitions.definition: used after a verb to emphasize a particular hope, wish, etc.

examples.text: I wish to God you'd learn to pay attention!
